original_title: Sri Lanka power minister submits parliamentary motion to oust PUCSL chairman
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara has submitted a motion to parliament seeking to remove Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Rathnayaka, an official said.
“The Minister submitted his report to Parliament today,” a ministry official said.
The minister’s report was presented in terms of Clause 7 of the Public Utilities Commission Act.
Prior to bringing in the motion, a charge sheet was sent to the Rantnayake with the President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s signature on March 22,2023.
Minister Wijesekera and Ratnayake clashed over price hikes and power cuts. A price hike in 2023 was opposed by Ratnayake.
Earlier this year, Minister Wijesekara vowed to bring in a motion against Ratnayake. (Colombo/ March 09/2023)
